SEARCH
Package gw.api.activity

Class ActivityDetailHelper

java.lang.Object
gw.api.activity.ActivityDetailHelper
public class ActivityDetailHelper extends Object
Helper for activity detail page. The activity detail page has a couple of peculiarities which require the use of a helper:
  1. When in edit mode, it creates a new note bean. If the user enters any information into this note then it should be committed together with any change the activity. But if the user leaves it alone then it should be removed from the bundle before commit.
  2. The complete and skip buttons commit the bundle but also complete or skip the activity. The complete/skip action needs to be taken right before the commit, and should be rolled back if the commit fails.
Both these peculiarities mean that work needs to be done right before the bundle is committed, after the usual validation steps. So this helper has a beforeCommit(entity.Activity) method that should be called by the location's beforeCommit hook. This hook always cleans up any empty activity note. It also commits or skips the activity if necessary, depending on whether the
invalid reference 
#skipBeforeCommit()
or
invalid reference 
#completeBeforeCommit()
methods have been called.

The activity detail helper also keeps track of whether the activity is currently open in a worksheet. When the worksheet is first entered it creates a new helper, and the helper registers the activity in the session. When the worksheet is committed or canceled the helper lets the session know that the worksheet is now closed.

Author:
tmorris
